discussion.content: It should option A. bcos prod and dev should communicate without going TOR

Based on the fact that says "How many total NSX manager cluster(s) will be deployed as part of the solution? " and assuming that DEV and PROD are VI Workload Domains, I'd go with C, since there must also be a Management Domain which will also have its own NSX Manager cluster that cannot be shared among other domains.

Otherwise I'd choose option A since we would be talking just about DEV and PROD VI Workload Domains and due to the fact that a single NSX Manager cluster could be shared among these domains.

- YoMeroElLechero

Selected Answer: C
They need are separated so answer C

questions.question_text:
During a VCF design workshop, the architect gathered the following customer requirements:

• There should be two environments: PROD and DEV.
• PROD and DEV workloads should communicate without traversing the physical network.
• The PROD workload domain should be separate from the DEV workload domain.
• The VCF infrastructure design should be flexible and scalable as much as possible.

How many total NSX manager cluster(s) will be deployed as part of the solution?

VLANs which are stretched between availability zones must meet the same requirements as the VLANs for intra-zone connection including MTU. MTU value must be consistent end-to-end including components on the inter-zone networking path. Set MTU values as follows.
MTU for all VLANs and Switch Virtual Interfaces (vMotion, Geneve, and Storage) to jumbo frames.
Management MTU to 1500.
Geneve overlay requires a minimum MTU of 1600.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/4.5/vcf-admin/GUID-A56D8E59-A549-4624-BC61-4A92710F9FA1.html

Selected Answer: A

questions.question_text:
A systems administrator is tasked to configure MTUs for the VCF components and plans on using the recommended MTU size of the Management VLAN for the two Availability Zones in implementing the stretched cluster.

What is the recommended MTU size?

discussion.content:
BD are correct

By default, SDDC Manager file-based backups are taken and stored on an SFTP server that built in to the SDDC Manager appliance.

Configuring an external SFTP server as a backup location is a best practice for the following reasons:
• An external SFTP server is a prerequisite for restoring SDDC Manager file-based backups.
• An external SFTP server provides better protection against failures because it decouples NSX-T Data Center backups from SDDC Manager backups.
• An external SFTP server provides better protection against failures because it means that the failed SDDC Manager does not take the SDDC Manager backups down with it.

From VMware Cloud Foundation: Deploy, Configure, Manage [V5.0] Lesson Book

Selected Answer: BD
B,D
Configuring an external SFTP server as a backup location is a best practice for the following

• An external SFTP server is a prerequisite for restoring SDDC Manager file-based backups.
• An external SFTP server provides better protection against failures because it decouples 
NSX-T Data Center backups from SDDC Manager backups.
• An external SFTP server provides better protection against failures because it means that 
the failed SDDC Manager does not take the SDDC Manager backups down with it.

Selected Answer: BD
It Backups the NSX-T and SDDC Manager .....the Cloud Builder has no BAckups there

Correct Answer is B & D.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/5.0/vcf-admin/GUID-F8634D37-FA26-40DF-A135-62D0265DA4FA.html

By default, NSX Manager file-based backups are taken and stored on an SFTP server that is built into the SDDC Manager appliance. It is recommended that you configure an external SFTP server as a backup location for the following reasons:

An external SFTP server is a prerequisite for restoring SDDC Manager file-based backups.

Using an external SFTP server provides better protection against failures because it decouples NSX backups from SDDC Manager.

choices.B: It provides better protection and decouples NSX-T backup from the SDDC Manager.
choices.A: It stores backup for vSAN encryption keys.
choices.D: It is a prerequisite for restoring SDDC Manager file-based backups.
choices.C: It is a prerequisite for restoring Cloud Builder file-based backups.
choices.E: It stores backup for vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager.

questions.question_text:
During a design workshop, an architect discussed strategies to backup and restore the SDDC Manager in a VMware Cloud Foundation environment. The customer asks for more clarification about the functionality and need for an external SFTP server.

Which two statements should the administrator share with the customer? (Choose two.)
